Reference

Source: vignettes/siteonly/reference.Rmd
reference.Rmd

Search globally in the search box below, or navigate the index clicking the menu on the right.

Global search

Explore fgeo

? fgeo_browse, fgeo_browse_reference Open a web browser on fgeo’s website.
? fgeo_help Get help with fgeo.

Plot

? autoplot Quick habitat plots.
? autoplot Quick plot of species distribution and/or topography.
? autoplot_by_species List plots of species distribution and topography (good for pdf output).
? plot_dbh_bubbles_by_quadrat List dbh bubble-plots by quadrat (good for .pdf output).
? plot_tag_status_by_subquadrat List plots of tree-tag status by subquadrat (good for .pdf output).

Abundance

? abundance, basal_area Abundance and basal area, optionally by groups.
? abundance_byyr, basal_area_byyr Create tables of abundance and basal area by year.

Demography

? recruitment_ctfs, mortality_ctfs, growth_ctfs Recruitment, mortality, and growth.
? to_df Dataframe objects of class “demography_ctfs”.

Habitat

? fgeo_elevation Structure elevation data.
? fgeo_habitat Structure habitat data from measures of topography.
? fgeo_topography Structure topography data with mean elevation, convexity, and slope.
? summary Summary objects of class “tt_lst”.
? to_df Dataframe objects of class “tt_lst”.
? tt_test Torus Translation Test to determine habitat associations of tree species.

Miscellaneous tools

Import ForestGEO data

? read_vft, read_taxa Import ViewFullTable and ViewTaxonomy from .tsv or .csv files.

Import multiple files from a directory into a list

Notice that function names have the format input_output.

? dir_list, rdata_list, rda_list, rds_list, csv_list, delim_list, tsv_list Import multiple files (.csv, excel, .Rdata, …) from a directory into a list.
? read_with Import multiple files into a list using any given reading function.

Export a list as multiple files in a directory

Notice that function names have the format input_output.

? list_csv Export mapping each dataframe in a list to a corresponding .csv file.
? list_df Help export a single file by reducing a list of dataframes to a single one.

Edit data in place

? sanitize_vft, sanitize_taxa Modify ViewFullTable and ViewTaxonomy to fix common data-structure issues.

Pick/drop rows with matching conditions

? pick_drop, pick_dbh_min, pick_dbh_max, pick_dbh_under, pick_dbh_over, pick_status, drop_status Pick and drop rows of a ForestGEO ViewFullTable or census table.
? pick_main_stem, pick_main_stemid Pick the main stem or main stemid(s) of each tree in each census.

Add new columns to a dataframe

? add_status_tree Add column ‘status_tree’ based on the status of all stems of each tree.
? add_subquad Add column ‘subquadrat’ based on ‘qx’ and ‘qy’ coordinates.
? add_var, add_lxly, add_qxqy, add_index, add_col_row, add_hectindex, add_quad Add columns ‘lx/ly’; ‘QX/QY’; ‘index’; ‘col/row’; and ‘hectindex’, ‘quad’.

Datasets

? datasets, elevation, habitat, stem5, stem6, taxa, tree5, tree6, vft_4quad, tree6_3species Datasets from Luquillo, Puerto Rico.
? download_data Download data from fgeo.data.
? example_path Path to directory containing example data.
